name: PRINCE2
description: PRINCE2 (Projects IN Controlled Environments) is a process-based method for effective project management, widely used in the UK and internationally.

principles.title: Continued business justification
principles.content: A PRINCE2 project must have continued business justification. There should be a clear business case answering why the project is being undertaken, what the benefits are, and what the costs and risks are.

principles.title: Learn from experience
principles.content: PRINCE2 project teams should learn from previous projects and apply those lessons throughout the current project's lifecycle.

principles.title: Define roles and responsibilities
principles.content: Clear organization structure with defined roles and responsibilities for everyone involved in the project, ensuring accountability and efficient decision-making.

principles.title: Manage by stages
principles.content: PRINCE2 projects are planned, monitored, and controlled on a stage-by-stage basis, with each stage representing a distinct part of the project.

principles.title: Manage by exception
principles.content: Establish tolerances for each project objective to define limits of delegated authority, enabling efficient use of management time and focus on exceptions.

principles.title: Focus on products
principles.content: PRINCE2 focuses on the definition and delivery of products, particularly their quality requirements, ensuring clear understanding of project deliverables.

principles.title: Tailor to suit the project environment
principles.content: PRINCE2 should be tailored to suit the project's environment, size, complexity, importance, capability, and risk.
